Will you join a community canvass near you this weekend?
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

When I think about how often we've fought to defend our democracy in the last few years, I know just how important elections are.

It's clear we need a president who commits to protecting and expanding our rights, especially if we want to actively strengthen civil liberties and civil rights in our country — and ACLU supporters are already working on it.

The Rights for All campaign is getting real commitments from presidential candidates on issues like creating pathways to citizenship, ending mass incarceration, and protecting abortion access. Presidential campaigns have been paying attention, and now we're moving onto the next phase of Rights for All.

We're talking one-on-one with Nevada voters about what's at stake next year, and this is your chance to make sure they show up to defend civil rights and liberties at the February primary.

Will you canvass in your community this weekend to defend rights for all, ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##?

Dinner & Door Knocking

Join us as we bring the fight for civil liberties to our own communities, training activists to speak to voters about why civil liberties need to be front and center in 2020.

Saturday, September 7, 5 p.m.
Rights for All Organizing Space
601 S Rancho Dr #B-13
Las Vegas, NV 89106

RSVP TODAY

We're starting early to make sure as many voters as possible know which of our rights are on the line this election season.

Together, we'll talk to voters about:

  • Expanding the fundamental right to vote to all citizens;
  • Creating pathways to citizenship for 11 million undocumented immigrants;
  • Protecting abortion access for everyone, no matter their income; and
  • Confronting the mass incarceration crisis by reducing incarceration by 50 percent.

These are some of the most pressing civil liberties issues right now, and something as simple as a conversation with a voter can motivate them to keep these issues at the top of their mind when they vote in a primary or caucus.

By going out into our communities and having these conversations, we can make sure every potential voter prioritizes rights for all.

I hope to see you soon,

Mia, Yasmeen, Rex, Barrington, and the rest of the Rights for All Nevada team
